This would be a good way to let us add shading/texture to bamboo builds and match how kelp etc has storage blocks.

Plus, sugar cane is a block players tend to farm in mass quantities (for rockets and trading) so being able to compact it down is genuinely useful.

Please bring back horses in boats. The loss of bringing my trusty steed with me on my adventures by has greatly reduced my satisfaction of the game. To do this while creating parity, have horses in boats on Java edition and Bedrock edition. I thought it was a Java bug that that edition could not do this. I am losing faith that the game developers understands what players want.

They are already in development for minecraft 1.20 in snapshots.
They're working on it. Patience...

Bundles are in the snapshot, though personally, I would love to see them buffed up a little to be more helpful. In addition to the 1 stack of random item rule they currently have, they should have 2 more:

1) hold 3 one-slots (tools, weapons, potions, compass, flint & steel, etc.) these items take up inventory in a way that needs address simply because these items are useful and something you want when you explore to maximize collecting. Many people suggest basically specific bundles for potions and tools (toolbelts) because of this common inventory problem.

2) hold 3 stacks of identical stackables (3 stacks [192] cobblestone, 48 snowballs, etc.) mostly plays out for builders or a very specific gathering operation, however, being limited to 3 stacks keeps it less useful than shulker boxes. Which is were most anti-bundle comments come from, though personally I see the bundle as part of progressive inventory ability.
infinite item slots

I feel like this update has a lot of untapped potential for everyone in the Minecraft community. Redstone, builders, and especially PVE members could take advantage in suggestions for this update, just like how it could've been for the caves & cliffs update. Ultimately, the representation of poets, warriors, and the imaginative is something we all of us should strive for.
How about players can design a history for each world that they create, and that also effects world generation?
That would be great

You know, back when spectator was was being worked on It wasn't called spectator mode it was called createWorldScreen.gameMode.spectator so something like that would be cool like creative.survival.fly.move.gamemode
This would be better off as a gamerule rather than a gamemode imo.
GOOD idea  could pair with a new enchantment called "menacing" which acts like a hostile mob repellent.
This could be a very large part of character customization. You be able to put designs on the hood just like a shield or banner. Also would the hood take the helmet slot or not?

Perhaps have them found in all structures and a villager trade and have a overlay like the Carved Pumpkin once worn. Also, the hood should also "hide" players from aggravated neutral mobs. For example, should you hurt a villager and aggravate a golem, wearing a hood will simply make the golem ignore you.
The first thing to do is to make sure that weapons, shields and tools are displayed in full size in a frame.
A weapon rack would be nice for full sized tools, whereas in an item frame would be too obstructive of a storage system.
I agree if they do add it in a future update it would make item storage much better and you could display you weapons and armours

That would be amazing

I think letting us change the rim of our Shields by placing any mineral (ones that work with Armour Trims) and any Shield in a Smithing Table would be lovely, but I don't see much use in making them whole new items. If you want your Shield to last longer, than you can use an Anvil to enchant it with Mending and Unbreaking.

As for tridents, while I believe Mojang has denied upgradable tridents, I think that's lame as heck and still agree they should be upgradable.
We need this for every biome PLEASE
